entry.et: Middle English probleme, from Latin problema, from Greek problēma, literally, obstacle, from proballein to throw forward, from pro- forward + ballein to throw pro-, devil

def.dt: :a question raised for inquiry, consideration, or solution
:a proposition in mathematics or physics stating something to be done
:a source of perplexity, distress, or vexation
:difficulty in understanding or accepting I have a problem with your saying that
:dealing with a problem of conduct or social relationship a problem play
:difficult to deal with a problem child
